definition: to bear/to carry/to hold/to continue/to undertake/to take charge/owing to/due to/to receive
surname Cheng/Cheng (c. 2000 BC), third of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)

sentences.english: Also the Kui gets thus, otherwise, really fear that that horse will accept to can not stand them.
sentences.chinese: 也亏得如此，不然，真怕那匹马会承受不了他们。

sentences.english: These materials are found capable of withstanding high temperature and high pressure.
sentences.chinese: 发现这些材料能承受高温高压。

sentences.english: We do not want to face US pressures on our own.
sentences.chinese: 我们不希望独自承受来自美国的压力。

sentences.english: His coach Sun Haiping said he was worried about the great pressure on Liu Xiang at this time.
sentences.chinese: 教练孙海平对刘翔此次所承受的压力表示担心。

sentences.english: If you expect the rainbow, you must first be used to experiencing storm.
sentences.chinese: 如果你期盼彩虹，那就应习惯承受风雨。

sentences.english: So how did we survive those three years of setbacks?
sentences.chinese: 我们是如何承受住那三年的挫折呢？

sentences.english: A changing climate is adding pressure to the already-stressed agricultural sector.
sentences.chinese: 气候变化正在增加农业部门已经承受的压力。

sentences.english: Closed-cell foam withstands years of use and abuse.
sentences.chinese: 闭孔泡沫能够承受多年的使用和滥用。

sentences.english: Storing conversational state in the database can be prohibitively expensive.
sentences.chinese: 在数据库中存储会话状态的成本可能难以承受。

sentences.english: " Only strong personalities can endure history, the weak ones are extinguished by it. " — Friedrich Nietzsche.
sentences.chinese: 只有刚烈的个性方能承受历史，懦弱的则消失其中。

sentences.english: Hot-water hoses must be reinforced to withstand high temperatures.
sentences.chinese: 热水管必须能承受高温。

sentences.english: However, the reality of leadership involves the heavy burden of responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 然而，事实上，领导承受着沉重的责任负担。

sentences.english: More incapable withstanding in all directions accusation.
sentences.chinese: 更无力承受四面八方的指责。

sentences.english: It's not a burden you have to carry any longer.
sentences.chinese: 那样它就不再是一个你必须承受的负担了。

sentences.english: She never let Michael see how hard this was on her.
sentences.chinese: 她从不让迈克尔看出这对她来说是多么难以承受。

definition: to bear/to carry on one's back/to shoulder
heavy load/heavy burden (also fig. of tax)
to share (a burden, a cost, a responsibility)
to resist/to hold back/to stop/to ward off/to withstand
